sparks.title: HTML
sparks.description: Hyper-Text Markup Language is the frame work from with a webpage is displayed

sparks.title: CSS
sparks.description: Cascading Style Sheets are how web pages are styled

sparks.title: JS
sparks.description: JavaScript is a object-model programming language used to add functionality to web pages

title: Physiology
description: A branch of biology that deals with the normal functions of living organisms and their parts.

sparks.title: Reciprocal Innervation
sparks.description: When contraction of a muscle is stimulated, there is a simultaneous inhibition of its antagonist. It is essential for coordinated movement.

sparks.title: Synapse
sparks.description: From the Greek terms “syn-” (together) and “haptein” (to clasp).

sparks.title: Vulpian-Heidenhain-Sherrington Phenomenon
sparks.description: Associated with Rudolf Peter Heinrich Heidenhain, Edmé Félix Alfred Vulpian, and Charles Scott Sherrington. Describes the slow contraction of denervated skeletal muscle by stimulating autonomic cholinergic fibres innervating its blood vessels.
